issue.subject: Distinguish mandatory information in metadata
issue.description:
It is important for metadata editor to know which mandatory fields must be filled in their formulary.
For now, a workaround is to add an asterisk at the end of each relation's label to mention such mandatory constraint.

This is not the right way and easySDI could be able to automaticall add such asterisk after each mandatory fields...

journals.notes:
Good point.
I suggest using a CSS class (at filed-group level) for this to allow each easySDI admin to customize the look of the fields/labels (asterisk, color, bold....)

The attribute "required" is already present on each field. 
Applying a css based on it should do the trick.

A default template should be give with easySDI.

h2. The problem I see now... ... is that *only the filed* (input, select,...) carries the "required" attributes. And afaik we cannot style parent, parent's siblings and cousins elements in CSS. A (simple) required field nesting looks like this: 
+---div.attribute-group... (id:attribute-group...) (easysdi specific)
    |
    \---div.control-group (bootstrap standard)
        |
        +---div.control-label
        |   |
        |   \---label (no class)
        |
        \---div.controls
            |
            \---select.required or input.required etc...
But may differ for special fields (stereotypes... with append for example): 
+---div.attribute-group... (id:attribute-group...) (easysdi specific)
    |
    \---div.control-group (bootstrap standard)
        |
        +---div.control-label
        |   |
        |   \---label (no class)
        |
        \---div.controls
            |
            \---div.input-append.file-controls
                |
                \input.required etc...
  +*So we cannot style the label*+ (add an asterisk, make it bol or red... as we're use to see in forms) h2. Proposal: add a custom class ("labelrequired") to the labels when we add the required attribute to the field. See: https://docs.joomla.org/Form_field#Common_attributes Result would be: 
+---div.attribute-group... (id:attribute-group...) (easysdi specific)
    |
    \---div.control-group (bootstrap standard)
        |
        +---div.control-label
        |   |
        |   \---label.labelrequired <<<<<<< this
        |
        \---div.controls
            |
            \---select.required or input.required etc...
*With it we can style both label and/or field* What do you guys think ? Note: The alternative is to add a class at the "div.attribute-group" level, but the would be more complex since this part may differ from stereotypes...

Villemagne Jérôme wrote:
> I'd like better attach the required mark to the label and not to the input...

Me too. (More "standard")

I proposed "labelrequired" to ensure that there will be no collision with the "required" class for bootstrap, validation, etc.
This may be a little paranoid, but there is multiple features working with the required class and the required attribute. And I cannot ensure they all work with a "fieldtag.requiredclass" logic or attributes selectors on specific html tags.
